rev.comment: Tidied up last edit a bit
Added coverage of the use of stem cells and tissue engineering to complement chemotheraphy
/* Complementary and alternative medicine */ linked laetrile
rv to last version by Jfdwolff
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/12.217.35.22|12.217.35.22]] to last version by Jfdwolff
/* Childhood cancers */ added ALL and its good prognosis in children
rv, does not do justice to the 100s of cancer and oncology journals (JCO, Br J Cancer, etc), as well as the core general journals (NEJM, Lancet, JAMA)
rv blanking of section - you do not appreciate the role of clinical trials in cancer
/* Treatment trials */ absolutely uninformative and off-topic
vandalism was a couple of days ago - trying an unprotect
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/195.93.21.104|195.93.21.104]] to last version by Spangineer
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/195.93.21.104|195.93.21.104]] to last version by Ahoerstemeier

Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/81.178.127.34|81.178.127.34]] to last version by Wimt
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/81.178.127.34|81.178.127.34]] to last version by Wimt

Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/81.178.127.34|81.178.127.34]] to last version by Natalinasmpf
America is not a country. America is not a continent. Encyclopedias don't use the term "American", but rather "of/in the [[United States]]"
/* Diagnosing cancer */ I do not support moving biopsy down in favour of screening; screening only yields the minority of cancer diagnoses
/* Causes and pathophysiology */ perfect solution! now I can elaborate in a new article!
/* Molecular biology */ rephrasing tumor suppressor and proto-oncogene relationship
/* Types of cancer */ following request, added 2005 USA relative statistics
/* See also */ * [[cancer quackery]] is a red link
fixed broken sentence, "required" for cancer is strange use for a noninitiated reader
"renegade" is a bit poetic, removing all those finer points that definitely do not need mention in a very broad intro
/* Molecular biology */ this article is very scant generally (despite length, the stuff on diagnosis needs to be branched), need more in terms of scientific concept
/* Types of cancer */ rm redundant preposition
hmm, I hope this sounds better
this makes it more scientifically accurate
you can't "prevent" cancer, you can certainly reduce the risk...in order to get cancer, a cell has to have a cascade of mistakes, many of them which can't be "prevented", but factors that can
/* Signs and symptoms */ tenderness is a form of pain, avoiding redlink
/* External links */ MedlinePlus - Cancer link - very comprehensive site by the National Library of Medicine
biopsy should be first - screening still only attracts the minority of cancer diagnoses
disagree - jaundice is usually local symptoms (think pancreatic ca), although it is encountered in *advanced* hepatic or portal metastasis
moved biopsy section to end of diagnosis
/* Screening */ write a bit on cervical cancer screening and breast cancer screening
/* Signs and symptoms */ jaundice is a systemic symptom.

trimmed external links to the useful ones; specific references to power lines and PSA are not helpful on this very general article; the links are very Americocentric - perhaps some WHO/worldwide links
the article later claims it's #1, and what has happened to all the other countries?
Harshened the oddly optimistic line in the intro about how many cancers can be treated and cured. (see Discussion)
rm cloned part of article, avoid redirect for TSH
/* Hormonal suppression */ don't remove it just because you are unfamiliar
/* Complementary and alternative medicine */ no bold, how do you block TSH??
/* Complementary and alternative medicine */ no bold
reverted changes by Vietbio. Potentially misleading CAM stuff. Please discuss on talk page.
rv - I don't understand how this contributes to the article. Please explain on discussion page.
removed a bit of off-topic info from origins of cancer
various small changes. Mostly removing overlinkage
moved experimental treatments from trials paragraph
removed main article link fom Chemotherapy para
various touchups - the "chemoprevention database" is only for colorectal cancer, and lacks scope for mentioning here
/* Prevention */ significant edits - pointed out that noisy newspaper reports are frequently based on nothing but animal studies
/* Environment and diet */ rm one image that only clutters due to size
/* Screening */ more emphasis on [[mammogram]]s for breast cancer - a more mature screening method than FOBC/colonoscopy
mainly restructuring - the list of tumors should go AFTER the diagnostic section - I disagree that complimentary/alternative therapies should be grouped as experimental (they're not)
rewrote lead, reordered some text, removed some text
/* Molecular biology */ correction - mutations not more frequent in mitosis.
decided to move [[artemisinin]] bit to [[experimental cancer treatment]]
corrected sp retinoblastoma, moved link from APC, moved artemisinin stuff to its page
corrected sp retinoblastoma, moved link from APC, moved artemisinin stuff to its page
/* Molecular biology */ not all carcinogens are mutagens
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/141.84.69.20|141.84.69.20]] to last version by Jfdwolff
apricot seeds are alternative medicine, mate
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/212.138.47.15|212.138.47.15]] to last version by Natalinasmpf
moving the treatment section down, like in all other medical articles
this is all you are getting for your pseudoscience
/* Treatment of cancer */ rearranged, wrote immunotherapy, removed pseudoscience as this is part of CAM

Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/68.62.8.145|68.62.8.145]] to last version by 24.207.220.129

/* Treatment of cancer */ more info about experimental treatments

Change to wording of first sentence: this solves my problem.
/* Complementary and alternative medicine */ This needs to be said.
rev to edits by 82.41.155.176 (useless uninformed statement about "prostrate[sic]" cancer)
rv, jaundice is due to biliary obstruction, or due to liver metastasis
/* Signs and symptoms */ moved jaundice to systemic symptoms

further revert to cover for all recent vandalism

/* Environment and diet */ "caused" is a rather heavy term
edited intro, many stylistic changes, moved morphology paragraph down, slashed some links
/* Radiation therapy */ removed paragraph on altered fractionation which is too detailed for an article on cancer.
obviously, chemotheropy _does_ interfere on a molecular level (otherwise it wouldn't be _chemo_therapy). interestingly, imanitinb is referenced on the chemotherapy page
/* Types of cancer */ fixed a link

Removed space before comma. I am a bot in testing. Please revert my change if it was incorrect. I will notice automatically.

rv further vandalism, back to Michael Hardy
/* Social impact */ War on Cancer and status as killer - should this go into a History section?

/* External links */ Addition of AICR link + brief note about AICR mission ... because I did not find AICR in Wikipedia when I went looking for it
partially rewrite intro - cancers are not related diseases, but really quite diverse, cells do normally proliferate quite extensively in various tissues. etc. etc.
combined two sections into a longer causative paragraph
/* Prevention */ reference to database with results of published randomized controlled trial

/* Surgery */ not just removing cells, also staging
/* The future, cancer research */ wrote something less glamorous - most cancer patients will not benefit from cancer research performed during their lifetime
